group.name: 1 Minute: a Vimeo Project
group.description:
Welcome to the 1 Minute Vimeo Project Group.  Add one video,         comment on two!

With the chaos of everyday life consuming our senses,         it is nice to sit back and enjoy moments and experiences that are often overlooked. This project aims to study the forgotten moments and times in life that we often pass by without acknowledging.

The rules:
-Video must be exactly one minute long
-No camera movement (no panning,         tilting,         etc)
-No editing whatsoever
-Use original sound
-Tag with '1 minute'
-Have fun

group.name: 5 Vignettes
group.description:
A variety of the '5 Vignettes' videos by the users of Vimeo. 

5 short,         5 second clips -- no music -- and try not to use clips you've used before :)

tag with: '5 Vignettes' and/or '5x5'

Learn how to edit with Windows Live Movie Maker!
http://vimeo.com/videoschool/lesson/23/video-101-editing-with-windows-live-movie-maker

Learn how to edit with iMovie!
http://vimeo.com/videoschool/lesson/33/video-101-editing-with-imovie

Learn how to capture great sound!
http://vimeo.com/videoschool/lesson/2/capturing-good-sound
group.featured_short_description: Each video consists of five,         five-second vignettes. Sometimes the shots are accidents.
group.featured_custom_description: Each video consists of five,         five-second vignettes. Sometimes the shots are accidents.

group.name: Canon EOS T2i Film-making
group.description:
DO post:
narrative films,         documentaries,         music videos,         experimental/art films,         movie trailers,         advertisements

Do NOT post:
test videos,         amateur home videos,         demo reels,         incomplete works

This group is intended exclusively for NARRATIVE FILMS,         DOCUMENTARIES or MUSIC VIDEOS shot in whole or in part with the Canon EOS T2i (550D,         Kiss X4) DSLR camera. EXPERIMENTAL films,         TRAILERS and ADVERTS may be allowed if they feel motivated. Music,         editing and titles help with this perception.

NO test videos,         demo reels,         amateur home videos or incomplete works,         please.

This group is less about how good you can make your footage look and more about how well you can tell a story with good-looking footage as a bonus.

Cinematographers: feel free to get technical with discussions and explanations regarding your work.

group.name: Food - video recipes
group.description:
This is a group for video recipes. 

Are you cooking dinner or baking a cake? Whip out your camera and cook together a video recipe at the same time,         then share it with others in this group.

Simple!

Please write the recipe in English in the description of your video.
That way,         everyone can try your fine recipe.

group.name: IndieSpot.tv: Featuring Independent Artists
group.description: A group to feature independent artists,         showing their talent,         interviews,         behind the scenes or anything related.  It can be anything from Musicians,         Bands,         Filmmakers,         Directors,         Editors,         Photographers,         Painters,         Sketch Artists,         Models,         Make-up Artists,         Stage Performers,         Entertainers,         Craft Makers,         Car or Bike Builders,         Promoters,         Venue Owners,         Business Founders,         Designers,         Manufactures,         or anyone else that has talent and an interesting story to tell. group.name: Taste of the World ◎ HD
group.description:
FOOD & TRAVEL,         they go together like burger & ketchup,         raw fish & rice,         Thai food & spice,         and whatever you can think of. Sharing only the best videos about all the yummy food in your travels. Something that will wet our appetites in sizzling HD quality.

Rather than how to cook food,         this is group is more about how to ENJOY food as an explorer of taste in this world flavors.


Bon Appetit  : )

group.name: The iPhone Film Makers

group.name: Timelapse
group.description:
This is the TimeLapse group for all your timelapse videos.

We love the fact you want to share your work but Please only post real timelapse videos! Timelapse videos are videos that consist of  speed up or slowed down shots.


To keep this group a sharing and learning place for all things timelapse,         here are a few suggestions:

Normal videos with a single timelapse shot might be rejected. Please don't post test shots unless they are really cool or you want to learn about something specific and have added a question in the description.

Anyone can add videos now,         if possible please add timelapse info. 

If you want to help out,         please let me know,         help is always needed to sort out the selection part of the group and perhaps weed out the very few misplaced videos we get these days.

Feel free to post any suggestions in the forum.

happy lapsing

thanks!
Maarten

group.name: Very Short Documentaries Film Festival
group.description:
This is a competition/library/festival/blog for very short documentaries between 1 and 150 seconds in length. 

We are open to Very Short Documentaries of all colours and creeds but will be paying particular attention to our Very Short Documentary Competition. 

Every few months we will unveil a title,         for example,         (the current title) Happiness or (maybe a future title) Table Top,         and we will ask you,         the good people of the world,         to create a very short documentary fashioned under that title. 

Currently,         to while away those winter blues we are delving into the pillow and unicorn lined world of HAPPINESS. 
We have and still are receiving a great number of amazing submissions for the Title HAPPINESS but be wary,         submissions will remain open but to be included in the competition you must enter your piece by the 31st of March. The winner will be anounced on the 10th of April.

For those of you who have no interest in happiness we can now unveil our new title. 

ODD

Interpret this title whichever way you must. We look forward to your submissions.

We are open to submissions from everyone.

Please when submitting specify which title you are submitting to.  

Every entry will be entered into a library specific to each Title,         and the winners of each Title (chosen by an ardent jury of documentarists) will be reviewed by prominent figures in the documentary world and will head each title archive.

The aim of this Festival/Blog is to champion the idea of very short documentaries and to create a library of interesting documentary films showing hundreds of interpretations of a particular title from hundreds of corners of the world. 

Very Short Documentaries are films that are between 1 second and one minute in length that explore the world and the documentary genre. They can be a flash of life,         a full on fly on the wall piece of direct cinema or a pre fabricated documentary drama. It could be a series of photographs set to music or an animation set to an audio interview. Maybe a visual twitter of your day or just your own thoughts around the subject title. Your film could use footage or audio that was recorded decades ago or 8 seconds ago,         using anything from a mobile phone to a 35mm movie camera.

Creating Very Short Documentaries is an amazing way to project an idea,         view or opinion into the world allowing for a lack of monetary expense. Our aim is for people without the means of funded productions to create standalone pieces of documentary film produced with as much passion,         thought and impact as their lengthier counterparts. Very Short Documentaries are a huge part of our video streaming world and many deserve the recognition that documentaries exceeding one minute are given. 

Please feel free to experiment with your own translation of the documentary genre,         extending your imagination to the furthest plateau to create a vignette of life from any audio visual medium.

We look forward to your submision.

group.name: World,         Travel & People HD
group.description:
'The World is our Home' and we can all learn many good things from each other. If we respect our world then we will all learn to respect each other. You can add your very best High Definition (HD) World,         Travel & People films here. 3D,         animations,         music,         nature,         sport,         wildlife,         time lapse,         space or about the environment are welcome. Emphasis is on quality rather than quantity,         so please do not add more than one or two films by yourself at any one time otherwise I guarantee nobody will probably watch it,          Enjoy!!! :))

Some of the best films added to our group will also feature on our World HD Channel. There are already nearly 2000 excellent films there. Check it out and subscribe to it today! :))
http://vimeo.com/channels/worldhd (World,         Travel & People HD Channel)
Some other great Groups & Channels;
http://vimeo.com/groups/thegoodstuff (Great films & talent)
http://vimeo.com/channels/iphonehd (Awesome IPhone films)
http://vimeo.com/channels/tfa30 (My Top 30)
http://vimeo.com/channels/latino (Latin American and Hispanic themes)
http://vimeo.com/groups/mobilehd (iPhone and Mobile HD group)
http://vimeo.com/channels/tfa (a plug for some of my best work! :))
